allodb 1.0.0.9000

Function to add new equations to the equation table (then used in the get_biomass function)

Source: R/add_equations.R
add_equation.Rd

This function creates S3 objects of class "numeric".

add_equation(taxa, allometry, coords, minDBH, maxDBH, sampleSize,
  unitDBH = "cm", unitOutput = "kg", inputVar = "DBH",
  outputVar = "Total aboveground biomass")

Arguments

taxa

character string or vector specifying the taxon (or taxa) for which the allometry has been calibrated
allometry

a character string with the allometric equation
coords

a vector or matrix of coordinates (longitude, latitude) of the calibration data
minDBH

numerical value, minimum DBH for which the equation is valid (in cm)
maxDBH

numerical value, maximum DBH for which the equation is valid (in cm)
sampleSize

number of measurements with which the allometry was calibrated
unitDBH

character string with unit of DBH in the equation (either cm, mm or inch). Default is cm.
unitOutput

character string with unit of equation output (either g, kg, Mg or lbs if the output is a mass, or m if the output is a height).
inputVar

independent variable(s) needed in the allometry. Default is DBH, other option is DBH, H.
outputVar

dependent variable estimated by the allometry. Default is Total aboveground biomass.

Value

A new equation table including all default equations and the additional equation (equation_id = new)

Examples

new_equations = add_equation(
  taxa = "Faga",
  allometry = "exp(-2+log(dbh)*2.5)",
  coords = c(-0.07, 46.11),
  minDBH = 5,
  maxDBH = 50,
  sampleSize = 50
)
